intro: Casearia ovoidea, commonly known as the egg-shaped casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Salicaceae, which includes willows and poplars. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces distinctive, egg-shaped fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. Casearia ovoidea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
